text: "Ia Ora 'o Tahiti Nui" (; ; "Long Live Tahiti Nui") is the anthem of French Polynesia. At official occasions, it is played alongside the French national anthem, "La Marseillaise". ==Lyrics== Tahitian original IPA transcription French translation English translation ğ„† Ê»Ua rahu te Atua (i) tÅÊ»u Ê»ÄiÊ»a Hono noÊ»anoÊ»a o te motu rau Heihei i te pua riÊ»i au Ä“ E firi nape mÅrohi Ê»ore Ê»O tÄÊ»u Ä«a e faÊ»ateniteni nei. ğ„‡ ğ„† TÄ“ tÅ«oro nei te reo here O te huia Ê»A hiÊ»i tÅ aroha Ê»Ia ora Ê»o Tahiti Nui Ä“! ğ„‡ ğ„† [Ê”u.a ra.hu te a.tu.a i toË.Ê”u Ê”aË.i.Ê”a] [ho.no no.Ê”a.no.Ê”a o te mo.tu rauÌ¯] [he.i.heiÌ¯ i te pu.a ri.Ê”i auÌ¯ eË] [e fi.ri na.pe moË.ro.hi Ê”o.re] [Ê”o taË.Ê”u iË.a e fa.Ê”a.te.ni.te.ni neiÌ¯] ğ„‡ ğ„† [teË tuË.o.ro neiÌ¯ te re.o he.re] [o te hu.i.a] [Ê”a hi.Ê”i toË a.ro.ha] [Ê”iÌ¯a o.ra Ê”o ta.hi.ti nu.i eË] ğ„‡ ğ„† Mon pays est nÃ© de Dieu Collier dâ€™Ã®les multiples Aux dÃ©licates senteurs ReliÃ©es dâ€™une tresse immortelle Aujourdâ€™hui je te loue. ğ„‡ ğ„† Voici que sâ€™Ã©lÃ¨ve la voix De tes enfants RÃ©pands ton amour Pour que vive Tahiti Nui! ğ„‡ ğ„† My country is born of God Multiple islandsâ€™ necklace With delicate fragrances Tied with an immortal braid Today I honour you. ğ„‡ ğ„† Here is the rising voice From your children Spread your love For Tahiti Nui to live! ğ„‡ ==References== Category:Oceanian anthems Category:French Polynesia Category:French anthems
